alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Halifax (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:08AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Edgecombe and eastern Halifax Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 608 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles northeast of Dortches to 6 miles southwest of Scotland Neck to 7 miles east of Tarboro. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Halifax, Scotland Neck, Enfield, Weldon, Whitakers, Hobgood, Speed, South Weldon, Tillery and Battleboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
